narratives.question_text: If a requirement, did this course occur in proper sequence within the School's educational program?  If not, where should it occur?
Comment on the body of material presented and the content of the course: sequence, syllabus, and assignments.
comments: The size and pace of the assignments along the semester was reasonable.

narratives.question_text: What were your expectations for this course and how well were they met?
comments: High expectations, mostly met. The quality of the course in this case mainly depends on student's work.

My expectations for this class were to learn about the history of furniture and furniture design, and to design and fabricate my own piece. My expectations for the latter were obviously met, but I wish there had been more of an emphasis on the former.

This was a fun course that certainly gets to the complexity and difficulty of furniture design. Its a great class in terms of the design and build process. very fast pace and not enough time to go back and make any corrections to your design. its almost a two semester course, once you see the final project, built before you- you see all the changes you want to make.

narratives.question_text: Comment on the value of this course to you.
comments: High value. Rear is the chance to make use of the school equipment to produce a full scale functioning prototype.

This class was an extremely valuable opportunity to immerse myself within a serious fabrication project, and due to the final success of this project, I would say that the course was very valuable to me.
extremely valuable. Peter is a great resource!

narratives.question_text: Comment on the effectiveness of the teaching by the courses's instructor
comments: Peter was always available supporting students with competence and resourcefulness. good inspiration and criticism.
Peter was a great teacherCraig was very helpful and accessible at any time, day or night.
Peter was good, i would have appreciated more critical design discussions.

narratives.question_text: Suggestions you may have for course improvements:
comments: Push harder right after midterm for the final prototype production. That would help students completing their work by the end of the semester.
After the final reviews I just thought that it would have been more helpful for us if we had more jurors and more feedback in the midterm review.
I would like to see more of a focus on the history of furniture and furniture fabrication. Perhaps a lecture or two?
fewer students? more class discusion- would have had more design input from other classmates.
